properties.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 31 at 3:20PM AKST until January 1 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage, AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Near zero visibility in
snow and blowing snow. Total snow accumulations of 7 to 11
inches. Southwest winds gusting as high as 40 mph.

* WHERE...Northern Kachemak Bay including Homer and the Homer
Bluff.

* WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on poor road conditions. Areas of blowing snow
will produce white-out conditions. Travel will be hazardous
through the overnight hours.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rapidly falling temperatures will occur
this evening and into tonight. Expect temperatures to drop to
about 13F by midnight with brisk winds.
properties.instruction:
weather to stay safe. Dress for cold conditions.

A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are
expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds
and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout
conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel,
have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay
with your vehicle.

For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit
511.alaska.gov.

NWSheadline: BLIZZARD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST WEDNESDAY
